intro: Rhynchospora marcelo-guerrae, commonly known as the Marcelo-Guerrae sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as wetlands and forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
